column1: Thank you. Thank you very much
column2: everybody. Sorry to keep you waiting. Complicated business. Complicated. Thank you very much.

column1: I've just received a call from Secretary Clinton. She congratulated us. It's about us. On our victory
column2: and I congratulated her and her family on a very
column3: very hard-fought campaign.

column1: I mean
column2: she fought very hard. Hillary has worked very long and very hard over a long period of time
column3: and we owe her a major debt of gratitude for her service to our country.

column1: I mean that very sincerely. Now it is time for America to bind the wounds of division
column2: have to get together. To all Republicans and Democrats and independents across this nation
column3: I say it is time for us to come together as one united people.

column1: It is time. I pledge to every citizen of our land that I will be President for all of Americans
column2: and this is so important to me. For those who have chosen not to support me in the past
column3: of which there were a few people
column4: I'm reaching out to you for your guidance and your help so that we can work together and unify our great country.

column1: As I've said from the beginning
column2: ours was not a campaign but rather an incredible and great movement
column3: made up of millions of hard-working men and women who love their country and want a better
column4: brighter future for themselves and for their family.

column1: It is a movement comprised of Americans from all races
column2: religions
column3: backgrounds
column4: and beliefs
column5: who want and expect our government to serve the people -- and serve the people it will.

column1: Working together
column2: we will begin the urgent task of rebuilding our nation and renewing the American dream. I've spent my entire life in business
column3: looking at the untapped potential in projects and in people all over the world.

column1: That is now what I want to do for our country. Tremendous potential. I've gotten to know our country so well. Tremendous potential. It is going to be a beautiful thing. Every single American will have the opportunity to realize his or her fullest potential.
The forgotten men and women of our country will be forgotten no longer.
We are going to fix our inner cities and rebuild our highways
column2: bridges
column3: tunnels
column4: airports
column6: hospitals. We're going to rebuild our infrastructure
column9: second to none. And we will put millions of our people to work as we rebuild it.

column1: We will also finally take care of our great veterans who have been so loyal
column2: and I've gotten to know so many over this 18-month journey.The time I've spent with them during this campaign has been among my greatest honors. Our veterans are incredible people.

column1: We will embark upon a project of national growth and renewal. I will harness the creative talents of our people
column2: and we will call upon the best and brightest to leverage their tremendous talent for the benefit of all. It is going to happen.

column1: We have a great economic plan. We will double our growth and have the strongest economy anywhere in the world. At the same time
column2: we will get along with all other nations willing to get along with us. We will be. We will have great relationships. We expect to have great
column3: great relationships.

column1: No dream is too big
column2: no challenge is too great. Nothing we want for our future is beyond our reach.

column1: America will no longer settle for anything less than the best. We must reclaim our country's destiny and dream big and bold and daring. We have to do that. We're going to dream of things for our country
column2: and beautiful things and successful things once again.

column1: I want to tell the world community that while we will always put America's interests first
column2: we will deal fairly with everyone
column3: with everyone. All people and all other nations.

column1: We will seek common ground
column2: not hostility; partnership
column3: not conflict.

column1: And now I would like to take this moment to thank some of the people who really helped me with this
column2: what they are calling tonight a very
column3: very historic victory.

column1: First
column2: I want to thank my parents
column3: who I know are looking down on me right now. Great people. I've learned so much from them. They were wonderful in every regard. Truly great parents.

column1: I also want to thank my sisters
column2: Marianne and Elizabeth
column3: who are here with us tonight. Where are they? They're here someplace. They're very shy
column4: actually.

column1: And my brother Robert
column2: my great friend. Where is Robert? Where is Robert?

column1: My brother Robert
column2: and they should be on this stage
column3: but that's okay. They're great.

column1: And also my late brother Fred
column2: great guy. Fantastic guy. Fantastic family. I was very lucky.

column1: Great brothers
column2: sisters
column3: great
column4: unbelievable parents.

column1: To Melania and Don and Ivanka and Eric and Tiffany and Barron
column2: I love you and I thank you
column3: and especially for putting up with all of those hours. This was tough.

column1: This was tough. This political stuff is nasty
column2: and it is tough.

column1: So I want to thank my family very much. Really fantastic. Thank you all. Thank you all. Lara
column2: unbelievable job. Unbelievable. Vanessa
column3: thank you. Thank you very much. What a great group.

column1: You've all given me such incredible support
column2: and I will tell you that we have a large group of people. You know
column3: they kept saying we have a small staff. Not so small. Look at all of the people that we have. Look at all of these people.

column1: And Kellyanne and Chris and Rudy and Steve and David. We have got tremendously talented people up here
column2: and I want to tell you it's been very
column3: very special.

column1: I want to give a very special thanks to our former mayor

column1: Gov. Chris Christie

column7: major politician. Let me tell you

column1: Up here. Really a friend to me
column2: but I'll tell you

column1: We have 22 Congressional Medal of Honor people. A very special person who
column2: believe me

column5: Reince is a superstar. I said
column6: they can't call you a superstar
column8: unless we win it. Like Secretariat. He would not have that bust at the track at Belmont.

column1: Reince is really a star and he is the hardest-working guy

column1: Boy

column3: boy

column1: Amazing guy. Our partnership with the RNC was so important to the success and what we've done
column2: so I also have to say
column3: I've gotten to know some incredible people.

column1: The Secret Service people. They're tough and they're smart and they're sharp and I don't want to mess around with them
column2: I can tell you. And when I want to go and wave to a big group of people and they rip me down and put me back down in the seat
column3: but they are fantastic people so I want to thank the Secret Service.

column1: And law enforcement in New York City
column2: they're here tonight. These are spectacular people
column3: sometimes underappreciated unfortunately. We appreciate them.

column1: So it's been what they call a historic event
column2: but to be really historic
column3: we have to do a great job
column4: and I promise you that I will not let you down. We will do a great job. We will do a great job. I look very much forward to being your president
column5: and hopefully at the end of two years or three years or four years or maybe even eight years you will say so many of you worked so hard for us
column6: with you. You will say that -- you will say that that was something that you were -- really were very proud to do and I can — thank you very much.

column1: And I can only say that while the campaign is over
column2: our work on this movement is now really just beginning. We're going to get to work immediately for the American people
column3: and we're going to be doing a job that hopefully you will be so proud of your President. You will be so proud. Again
column4: it's my honor.

column1: It's an amazing evening. It's been an amazing two-year period
column2: and I love this country. Thank you.

column1: Thank you very much. Thank you to Mike Pence.
My fellow Americans
Tonight
column2: I am speaking to you because there is a growing humanitarian and security crisis at our southern border.

column1: Every day
column2: customs and border patrol agents encounter thousands of illegal immigrants trying to enter our country. We are out of space to hold them
column3: and we have no way to promptly return them back home to their country.

column1: America proudly welcomes millions of lawful immigrants who enrich our society and contribute to our nation. But all Americans are hurt by uncontrolled
column2: illegal migration. It strains public resources and drives down jobs and wages. Among those hardest hit are African Americans and Hispanic Americans.

column1: Our southern border is a pipeline for vast quantities of illegal drugs
column2: including meth
column3: heroin
column4: cocaine
column6: 300 of our citizens are killed by heroin alone
column7: 90% of which floods across from our southern border. More Americans will die from drugs this year than were killed in the entire Vietnam war.

column1: In the last two years
column2: ICE officers made 266
column3: 000 arrests of aliens with criminal records
column4: including those charged or convicted of 100
column10: thousands of Americans have been brutally killed by those who illegally entered our country
column11: and thousands more lives will be lost if we don’t act right now.

column1: Last month
column3: 000 migrant children were illegally brought into the United States – a dramatic increase. These children are used as human pawns by vicious coyotes and ruthless gangs. One in three women are sexually assaulted on the dangerous trek up through Mexico. Women and children are the biggest victims
column4: by far

column1: This is the tragic reality of illegal immigration on our southern border. This is the cycle of human suffering that I am determined to end.
My administration has presented Congress with a detailed proposal to secure the border and stop the criminal gangs
column2: drug smugglers
column3: and human traffickers. It’s a tremendous problem. Our proposal was developed by law enforcement professionals and border agents at the Department of Homeland Security. These are the resources they have requested to properly perform their mission and keep America safe. In fact
column4: safer than ever before.

column1: We will no longer accept politicians who are all talk and no action - constantly complaining but never doing anything about it.
The time for empty talk is over.
Now arrives the hour of action.
Do not allow anyone to tell you that it cannot be done. No challenge can match the heart and fight and spirit of America.
We will not fail. Our country will thrive and prosper again.
We stand at the birth of a new millennium
column2: ready to unlock the mysteries of space
column3: to free the Earth from the miseries of disease
column4: and to harness the energies

column1: A new national pride will stir our souls
column2: lift our sights
column3: and heal our divisions.

column1: It is time to remember that old wisdom our soldiers will never forget: that whether we are black or brown or white
column2: we all bleed the same red blood of patriots
column3: we all enjoy the same glorious freedoms
column4: and we all salute the same great American Flag.

column1: And whether a child is born in the urban sprawl of Detroit or the windswept plains of Nebraska
column2: they look up at the same night sky
column3: they fill their heart with the same dreams
column4: and they are infused with the breath of life by the same almighty Creator.

column1: So to all Americans
column2: in every city near and far
column3: small and large
column4: from mountain to mountain

column1: You will never be ignored again.
Your voice
column2: your hopes
column3: and your dreams
column4: will define our American destiny. And your courage and goodness and love will forever guide us along the way.

column1: Together
column2: we will make America strong again.

column1: We will make America wealthy again.
We will make America proud again.
We will make America safe again.
And
column2: yes
column3: together
column4: we will make America great again.

column1: We will reinforce old alliances and form new ones - and unite the civilised world against radical Islamic terrorism
column2: which we will eradicate completely from the face of the Earth.

column1: At the bedrock of our politics will be a total allegiance to the United States of America
column2: and through our loyalty to our country
column3: we will rediscover our loyalty to each other.

column1: When you open your heart to patriotism
column2: there is no room for prejudice.

column1: The Bible tells us: "How good and pleasant it is when God's people live together in unity."
We must speak our minds openly
column2: debate our disagreements honestly
column3: but always pursue solidarity.

column1: When America is united
column2: America is totally unstoppable.

column1: There should be no fear - we are protected
column2: and we will always be protected.

column1: We will be protected by the great men and women of our military and law enforcement and
column2: most importantly
column3: we will be protected by God.

column1: Finally
column2: we must think big and dream even bigger.

column1: In America
column2: we understand that a nation is only living as long as it is striving.

column1: The proposal from Homeland Security includes cutting-edge technology for detecting drugs
column2: weapons
column3: illegal contraband
column4: and many other things. We have requested more agents
column6: and bed space to process the sharp rise in unlawful migration fuelled by our very strong economy. Our plan also contains an urgent request for humanitarian assistance and medical support.

column1: Furthermore
column2: we have asked Congress to close border security loopholes so that illegal immigrant children can be safely and humanely returned back home.

column1: Finally
column2: as part of an overall approach to border security
column3: law enforcement professionals have requested $5.7 billion for a physical barrier. At the request of Democrats
column4: it will be a steel barrier rather than a concrete wall. This barrier is absolutely critical to border security. It’s also what our professionals at the border want and need. This is just common sense.

column1: The border wall would very quickly pay for itself. The cost of illegal drugs exceeds $500bn a year – vastly more than the $5.7bn we have requested from Congress. The wall will also be paid for
column2: indirectly
column3: by the great new trade deal we have made with Mexico.

column1: Senator Chuck Schumer – who you will be hearing from later tonight – has repeatedly supported a physical barrier in the past
column2: along with many other Democrats. They changed their mind only after I was elected president.

column1: Democrats in Congress have refused to acknowledge the crisis. And they have refused to provide our brave border agents with the tools they desperately need to protect our families and our nation.
But that is the past. And now we are looking only to the future.
We assembled here today are issuing a new decree to be heard in every city
column2: in every foreign capital
column3: and in every hall of power.

column1: From this day forward
column2: a new vision will govern our land.

column1: From this day forward
column2: it's going to be only America First
column3: America First.

column1: Every decision on trade
column2: on taxes
column3: on immigration
column4: on foreign affairs
column5: will be made to benefit American workers and American families.

column1: We must protect our borders from the ravages of other countries making our products
column2: stealing our companies
column3: and destroying our jobs. Protection will lead to great prosperity and strength.

column1: I will fight for you with every breath in my body - and I will never
column2: ever let you down.

column1: America will start winning again
column2: winning like never before.

column1: We will bring back our jobs. We will bring back our borders. We will bring back our wealth. And we will bring back our dreams.
We will build new roads
column2: and highways
column3: and bridges
column4: and airports
column6: and railways all across our wonderful nation.

column1: We will get our people off of welfare and back to work - rebuilding our country with American hands and American labour.
We will follow two simple rules: Buy American and hire American.
We will seek friendship and goodwill with the nations of the world - but we do so with the understanding that it is the right of all nations to put their own interests first.
We do not seek to impose our way of life on anyone
column2: but rather to let it shine as an example - we will shine - for everyone to follow

column1: January 20th
column3: will be remembered as the day the people became the rulers of this nation again.

column1: The forgotten men and women of our country will be forgotten no longer.
Everyone is listening to you now.
You came by the tens of millions to become part of a historic movement the likes of which the world has never seen before.
At the centre of this movement is a crucial conviction: that a nation exists to serve its citizens.
Americans want great schools for their children
column2: safe neighbourhoods for their families
column3: and good jobs for themselves.

column1: These are the just and reasonable demands of righteous people and a righteous public.
But for too many of our citizens
column2: a different reality exists: Mothers and children trapped in poverty in our inner cities; rusted-out factories scattered like tombstones across the landscape of our nation; an education system
column3: flush with cash
column4: but which leaves our young and beautiful students deprived of all knowledge; and the crime and the gangs and the drugs that have stolen too many lives and robbed our country of so much unrealised potential.

column1: This American carnage stops right here and stops right now.
We are one nation - and their pain is our pain. Their dreams are our dreams; and their success will be our success. We share one heart
column2: one home
column3: and one glorious destiny.

column1: The oath of office I take today is an oath of allegiance to all Americans.
For many decades
column2: we've enriched foreign industry at the expense of American industry;

column1: Subsidised the armies of other countries while allowing for the very sad depletion of our military;
We've defended other nations' borders while refusing to defend our own;
And spent trillions and trillions of dollars overseas while America's infrastructure has fallen into disrepair and decay.
We've made other countries rich while the wealth
column2: strength
column3: and confidence of our country has dissipated over the horizon.

column1: One by one
column2: the factories shuttered and left our shores
column3: with not even a thought about the millions and millions of American workers that were left behind.

column1: The wealth of our middle class has been ripped from their homes and then redistributed all across the world.
The federal government remains shut down for one reason and one reason only: because Democrats will not fund border security.

My administration is doing everything in our power to help those impacted by the situation. But the only solution is for Democrats to pass a spending bill that defends our borders and re-opens the government.
This situation could be solved in a 45-minute meeting. I have invited congressional leadership to the White House tomorrow to get this done. Hopefully
column2: we can rise above partisan politics in order to support national security.

column1: Some have suggested a barrier is immoral. Then why do wealthy politicians build walls
column2: fences
column3: and gates around their homes? They don’t build walls because they hate the people on the outside
column4: but because they love the people on the inside. The only thing that is immoral is the politicians to do nothing and continue to allow more innocent people to be so horribly victimized.

column1: To every member of Congress: pass a bill that ends this crisis.
To every citizen: call Congress and tell them to finally
column2: after all of these decades
column3: secure our border.

column1: This is a choice between right and wrong
column2: justice and injustice. This is about whether we fulfill our sacred duty to the American citizens we serve.

column1: When I took the oath of office
column2: I swore to protect our country. And that is what I will always do
column3: so help me God.

column1: Thank you and goodnight.We
column2: the citizens of America
column3: are now joined in a great national effort to rebuild our country and to restore its promise for all of our people.

column1: Together
column2: we will determine the course of America
column3: and the world
column4: for many

column1: We will face challenges. We will confront hardships. But we will get the job done.
Every four years
column2: we gather on these steps to carry out the orderly and peaceful transfer of power
column3: and we are grateful to President Obama and First Lady Michelle Obama for their gracious aid throughout this transition. They have been magnificent.

column1: Today's ceremony
column2: however
column3: has very special meaning. Because today we are not merely transferring power from one administration to another
column4: or from one party to another - but we are transferring power from Washington
column5: D.C. and giving it back to you

column1: For too long
column2: a small group in our nation's capital has reaped the rewards of government while the people have borne the cost.

column1: Washington flourished - but the people did not share in its wealth.
Politicians prospered - but the jobs left
column2: and the factories closed.

column1: The establishment protected itself
column2: but not the citizens of our country.

column1: Their victories have not been your victories; their triumphs have not been your triumphs; and while they celebrated in our nation's capital
column2: there was little to celebrate for struggling families all across our land.

column1: That all changes - starting right here
column2: and right now
column3: because this moment is your moment: it belongs to you.

column1: It belongs to everyone gathered here today and everyone watching all across America.
This is your day. This is your celebration.
And this
column2: the United States of America
column3: is your country.

column1: What truly matters is not which party controls our government
column2: but whether our government is controlled by the people.

column1: America’s heart broke the day after Christmas when a young police officer in California was savagely murdered in cold blood by an illegal alien
column2: who just came across the border. The life of an American hero was stolen by someone who had no right to be in our country.

column1: Day after day
column2: precious lives are cut short by those who have violated our borders. In California
column3: an Air Force veteran was raped
column4: murdered
column5: and beaten to death with a hammer by an illegal alien with a long criminal history. In Georgia
column6: an illegal alien was recently charged with murder for killing

column1: In Maryland
column2: MS-13 gang members who arrived in the United States as unaccompanied minors were arrested and charged last year after viciously stabbing and beating a 16-year-old girl.

column1: Over the last several years
column2: I’ve met with dozens of families whose loved ones were stolen by illegal immigration. I’ve held the hands of the weeping mothers and embraced the grief-stricken fathers. So sad. So terrible. I will never forget the pain in their eyes
column3: the tremble in their voices
column4: and the sadness gripping their souls.

column1: How much more American blood must we shed before Congress does its job?
To those who refuse to compromise in the name of border security
column2: I would ask: imagine if it was your child
column3: your husband
column4: or your wife whose life was so cruelly shattered and totally broken?

column1: Our great American forces are prepared for anything.  Iran appears to be standing down
column2: which is a good thing for all parties concerned and a very good thing for the world.

column1: No American or Iraqi lives were lost because of the precautions taken
column2: the dispersal of forces
column3: and an early warning system that worked very well.  I salute the incredible skill and courage of America’s men and women in uniform.

column1: For far too long — all the way back to 1979
column2: to be exact — nations have tolerated Iran’s destructive and destabilizing behavior in the Middle East and beyond.  Those days are over.  Iran has been the leading sponsor of terrorism
column3: and their pursuit of nuclear weapons threatens the civilized world.  We will never let that happen.

column1: Last week
column2: we took decisive action to stop a ruthless terrorist from threatening American lives.  At my direction
column3: the United States military eliminated the world’s top terrorist
column4: Qasem Soleimani.  As the head of the Quds Force
column5: Soleimani was personally responsible for some of the absolutely worst atrocities.

column1: He trained terrorist armies
column2: including Hezbollah
column3: launching terrorist strikes against civilian targets.  He fueled bloody civil wars all across the region.  He viciously wounded and murdered thousands of U.S. troops
column4: including the planting of roadside bombs that maim and dismember their victims.

column1: Soleimani directed the recent attacks on U.S. personnel in Iraq that badly wounded four service members and killed one American
column2: and he orchestrated the violent assault on the U.S. embassy in Baghdad.  In recent days
column3: he was planning new attacks on American targets
column4: but we stopped him.

column1: Soleimani’s hands were drenched in both American and Iranian blood.  He should have been terminated long ago.  By removing Soleimani
column2: we have sent a powerful message to terrorists: If you value your own life
column3: you will not threaten the lives of our people.

column1: As we continue to evaluate options in response to Iranian aggression
column2: the United States will immediately impose additional punishing economic sanctions on the Iranian regime.  These powerful sanctions will remain until Iran changes its behavior.

column1: In recent months alone
column2: Iran has seized ships in international waters
column3: fired an unprovoked strike on Saudi Arabia
column4: and shot down two U.S. drones.

column1: Iran’s hostilities substantially increased after the foolish Iran nuclear deal was signed in 2013
column2: and they were given $150 billion
column3: not to mention $1.8 billion in cash.  Instead of saying “thank you” to the United States
column4: they chanted “death to America.”  In fact
column5: they chanted “death to America” the day the agreement was signed.

column1: Then
column2: Iran went on a terror spree
column3: funded by the money from the deal
column4: and created hell in Yemen
column8: and Iraq.  The missiles fired last night at us and our allies were paid for with the funds made available by the last administration.  The regime also greatly tightened the reins on their own country
column10: 500 people at the many protests that are taking place all throughout Iran.

column1: The very defective JCPOA expires shortly anyway
column2: and gives Iran a clear and quick path to nuclear breakout.  Iran must abandon its nuclear ambitions and end its support for terrorism.  The time has come for the United Kingdom
column3: Germany
column4: France
column6: and China to recognize this reality.

column1: They must now break away from the remnants of the Iran deal -– or JCPOA –- and we must all work together toward making a deal with Iran that makes the world a safer and more peaceful place.  We must also make a deal that allows Iran to thrive and prosper
column2: and take advantage of its enormous untapped potential.  Iran can be a great country.

column1: Peace and stability cannot prevail in the Middle East as long as Iran continues to foment violence
column2: unrest
column3: hatred
column4: and war.  The civilized world must send a clear and unified message to the Iranian regime: Your campaign of terror
column6: mayhem will not be tolerated any longer.  It will not be allowed to go forward.

column1: Today
column2: I am going to ask NATO to become much more involved in the Middle East process.  Over the last three years
column3: under my leadership
column4: our economy is stronger than ever before and America has achieved energy independence.  These historic accompliments [accomplishments] changed our strategic priorities.  These are accomplishments that nobody thought were possible.  And options in the Middle East became available.  We are now the number-one producer of oil and natural gas anywhere in the world.  We are independent
column5: and we do not need Middle East oil.

column1: The American military has been completely rebuilt under my administration
column2: at a cost of $2.5 trillion.  U.S. Armed Forces are stronger than ever before.  Our missiles are big
column3: powerful
column4: accurate
column6: and fast.  Under construction are many hypersonic missiles.

column1: The fact that we have this great military and equipment
column2: however
column3: does not mean we have to use it.  We do not want to use it.  American strength
column4: both military and economic

column1: Three months ago
column2: after destroying 100 percent of ISIS and its territorial caliphate
column3: we killed the savage leader of ISIS
column4: al-Baghdadi
column5: who was responsible for so much death
column6: including the mass beheadings of Christians
column8: and all who stood in his way.  He was a monster.  Al-Baghdadi was trying again to rebuild the ISIS caliphate

column1: Tens of thousands of ISIS fighters have been killed or captured during my administration.  ISIS is a natural enemy of Iran.  The destruction of ISIS is good for Iran
column2: and we should work together on this and other shared priorities.

column1: Finally
column2: to the people and leaders of Iran: We want you to have a future and a great future — one that you deserve
column3: one of prosperity at home
column4: and harmony with the nations of the world.  The United States is ready to embrace peace with all who seek it.

column1: I want to thank you
column2: and God bless America. Thank you very much. Thank you. Thank you.
